title: 103_hr2912
content:
There are no paragraphs provided in the prev_chunk, so I will summarize the curr_chunk directly.

Summarized chunk:
"SECTION 1. FINDINGS." "Congress finds that the free exchange of ideas and information through modern telecommunications equipment promotes democratic institutions, economic competitiveness, and international commerce. Export restrictions on outdated telecommunications equipment hinder US economic growth and job creation." Foreign availability of telecommunications equipment and technology exists from countries not cooperating with export control committees. Export controls on telecommunications are addressed in Section 2. The Export Administration Act of 1979 is amended to propose that exports of telecommunications equipment and technology for civil end uses to certain countries do not require a validated license. This amendment aims to ease export controls on telecommunications. The Export Administration Act of 1979 is amended to ease export controls on telecommunications equipment and technology for civil end uses to certain countries. This includes stored program controlled communications switching systems, telecommunications transmission equipment, microwave and light wave equipment, telecommunications cables, and equipment containing frequency synthesizers for land-based mobile communications systems. The Export Administration Act of 1979 is amended to ease export controls on telecommunications equipment and technology for civil end uses to certain countries, including equipment related to data communications, lasers, computer hardware, software, spare parts, and measuring equipment. Telecommunications technology refers to technology related to telecommunications. The Export Administration Act of 1979 is amended to ease export controls on telecommunications equipment and technology for civil end uses to certain countries. Telecommunications technology refers to technology related to the production, development, and use of telecommunications equipment, including voice, video, and data communications over any public or private network. The President must submit a report certifying the proposal within 60 days of the enactment of this Act. The Senate report certifies the proposal made to the Coordinating Committee under the Export Administration Act of 1979, outlining plans to gain concurrence from other committee members.
